<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Current Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=1714) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Druid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=52" />
<trait label="Metamagic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=107" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 124 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Elementalist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=98) (Level 8)

</column>

---

As you use your magic to manipulate air or water, you divert some of its currents to form a barrier around you. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with the [air](/Traits.aspx?ID=5) or [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165) trait, until the start of your next turn, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC or a +2 circumstance bonus against ranged attacks. This effect has the air or water trait, or both, depending on the traits of the spell you cast. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all saves against effects with the air trait, water trait, or both until the start of your next turn, depending on the spell's traits.
